conclusion: The output power of the power source can be calculated using the formula P = VI.
From the graph, the terminal voltage is 3V when the current is 0A, and the terminal voltage is 0V when the current is 3A.
The internal resistance of the power source is 3Ω.
The resistor R has a resistance of 1Ω.
When the power source is directly connected to the resistor R, the total resistance of the circuit is 4Ω.
The current in the circuit is 3A, and the terminal voltage is 1V.
The output power of the power source is P = VI = 1V × 3A = 3W.
